availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Isham Curtis Moody (Henry County, Kentucky, resident and murder victim.)

body.p: Henry County, Kentucky, resident. Henry County, Kentucky, native. Son of Isham W. Moody and Eliza J. Moody. Student in Henry County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned eight enslaved persons in Henry County in 1850. Resident of Henry County in 1860. Household owned eight enslaved persons in Henry County in 1860. Murdered in Shelby County, Kentucky in 1862.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henry County, District 2, p. 441B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Henry County, District 2, p. 627.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henry County, District 1, p. 142.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henry County, District 1, p. 191A.
"Isham Curtis Moody (1842-1862)," Find A Grave, Memorial #65940000, accessed March 26, 2022, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/65940000.
